metadata.Title: CVE-2020-4788 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
IBM Power9 (AIX 7.1, 7.2, and VIOS 3.1) processors could allow a local userto obtain sensitive information from the data in the L1 cache underextenuating circumstances. IBM X-Force ID: 189296.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-4788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1032.33~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1034.35~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1032.34~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1033.35
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1032-gke - 5.4.0-1032.34~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1007-gkeop - 5.4.0-1007.8~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1009-dell300x - 4.15.0-1009.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-126.129').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
